meanings.definition: To steer incorrectly or in a wrong direction.
meanings.sent1: She kept missteering the bicycle and almost hit a tree.
meanings.sent2: The driver missteered the car into the wrong lane.
meanings.sent3: His missteering of the remote control car made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The captain missteered the ship towards the dangerous rocks.
meanings.sent5: Missteering the conversation towards a sensitive topic caused tension.

meanings.definition: The act of steering a vehicle or vessel in a mistaken or faulty manner.
meanings.sent1: The missteering of the boat led to it getting stuck on the sandbar.
meanings.sent2: The instructor corrected the student's missteering during the driving lesson.
meanings.sent3: The robot's missteering around the room was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The missteering of the spaceship caused it to veer off course.
meanings.sent5: The missteering of the shopping cart made a loud clattering noise.
